snippet: The closely contested presidential election, originally scheduled for next Saturday, will be held March 28, an official said. And analysts say that the ruling party feared losing the vote.
abstract: Nigeria postpones presidential election between Pres Jonathan Goodluck, a Christian, and Muhammadu Buhari, a general and Muslim, until March 28 because of security concerns; Goodluck has come under fire for, among other things, his inability to protect country from terrorist group Boko Haram.
lead_paragraph: The closely contested presidential election, originally scheduled for next Saturday, will be held March 28, an official said. And analysts say that the ruling party feared losing the vote.

headline.main: Nigeria Postpones Elections, Saying Security Is a Concern
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Postpones Elections, Saying Security Is a Concern
